job description:
The Quality Data Analyst is responsible for SAP quality support activities. Provide technical support specifically for SAP QM business processes/requirements, functional and technical specifications.

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • QA Data Producer for MDG Materials - produces the QM views for all appropriate material types within the process of maintaining material master in ECC/EWM.
  • Provides business processes/requirements, functional and technical specification support to ensure system efficiency and integration with the overall solution.
  • Actively monitor and optimize QM inspection setup to ensure accuracy.
  • Supports existing system in plant QA lab operations.
  • Assists in creating documents for newly implemented systems and/or processes - creates job aids and work instructions for end users.
  • Exercises independent judgement and decision making, based on system and subject matter expertise.
  • Approves QM security role adjustments to meet the changing business environment.
  • Ability to design and create reports using data in relevant SAP modules (ECC, EWM, GBT, DMS).
  • Comply with the Saputo Code of Ethics and Actively apply the Saputo Values.
  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Job Requirements
  • Bachelor's Degree, with a concentration in Food Safety, Microbiology or equivalent.
  • Practical lab experience preferred, include knowledge of current lab practices (Sampling, testing, and reporting, incoming inspection, production inspections, goods receipt inspections, distribution inspections, customer return inspections).
  • Business experience that includes experience with QA/QC/QM systems, procurement, production execution, warehouse management is preferred.
  • Previous experience in QM, Materials Management, Production Planning (PP) preferred.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
  • Excellent presentation, documentation, and project management skills.
  • Ability to work independently or within a team environment.
  • Ability to communicate effectively (written, verbal) with all levels throughout the organization.
  • Ability to adapt to changing organizational and operational needs; ability to lead others through change.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Skill in organization and prioritization, and attention to detail.
  • Strong team player and leader with the ability to work across multiple functions and disciplines.
  • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
  • Ability to work flexible hours and provide after-hours support.
Relocation Offered

Exemption Type

Exempt
